generif.text: HOX11L2 expression defines a clinical subtype of pediatric T-ALL associated with poor prognosis.

Results identify Tlx3 as a novel target for canonical Wnt signaling that confers somatic stem cells with a sensory neuron phenotype upon neural induction.

We found that 22 (21%) out of 110 clinical samples of bladder cancer showed the methylated pattern using the COBRA assay in TLX3. We found a correlation between TLX3 methylation and the sensitivity to cisplatin in the clinical samples by SDI test.
these results place TLX1 and TLX3 at the top of an oncogenic transcriptional network controlling leukemia development, and identify RUNX1 as a tumor-suppressor gene in T-ALL
The cortical thymic maturation arrest in T-lineage Acute lymphoblastic leukemias (ALLs) that overexpress TLX1 or TLX3 is due to binding of TLX1/TLX3 to ETS1.

Egyptian T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia cases seemed to have a different genetic pattern compared to other populations, with a lower incidence of TLX3/HOX11L2 and SIL/TAL but a higher incidence of NKX2-5 expression than recorded in Western countries
Studies suggest that homeobox protein TLX3 expression is not an indicator for the prognosis of pediatric T cell acute lymphocytic leukemia (T-ALL).

name: T cell leukemia homeobox 3

kegg.name: Transcriptional misregulation in cancer - Homo sapiens (human)

wikipathways.name: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) Susceptibility Pathways

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is an orphan homeobox protein that encodes a DNA-binding nuclear transcription factor. A translocation [t(5;14)(q35;q32)] involving this gene is associated with T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (T-ALL) in children and young adults. [provided by RefSeq, Nov 2015].
